title: Kwok Kar Lok
text:
Kenneth Kwok Kar Lok (; born 14 March 1980) is a <a href="Hong%20Kong%20people">Hong Kong</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="manager%20%28association%20football%29">coach</a> and former player.
He is the son of former Taiwan international <a href="Kwok%20Kam-hung">Kwok Kam-hung</a>.
Club career.
Kwok did not have a successful football playing career, while he only played for the newly-promoted side <a href="HKFC%20Soccer%20Section">HKFC</a> in the 2010–11 season. 
Managerial career.
Pegasus.
In 2012, Kwok joined <a href="TSW%20Pegasus%20FC">Pegasus</a> as an assistant coach alongside <a href="Chan%20Chi%20Hong">Chan Chi Hong</a>. 
Hong Kong youth teams.
In 2015, Kwok was appointed as the head coach of <a href="Hong%20Kong%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Hong Kong U-17</a> and <a href="Hong%20Kong%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Hong Kong U-20</a>. 
In August 2017, Kwok was appointed as the head coach of Hong Kong B, leading the team to defeat Macau in the 73rd <a href="Hong%20Kong%E2%80%93Macau%20Interport">Hong Kong–Macau Interport</a> by 4–0. In December of the same year, he led the team to win the title of the <a href="2018%20Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong%20Kong%20Cup">2018 Guangdong–Hong Kong Cup</a> after beating Guangdong in the penalty shoot-out. 
In April 2018, Kwok was appointed as the head coach of <a href="Hong%20Kong%20national%20under-23%20football%20team">Hong Kong U-23</a> to participate in the <a href="2018%20Asian%20Games">2018 Asian Games</a>. His team was finally knocked out in the Round of 16. 
In December 2018, he was appointed as the head coach of Hong Kong B again to play against Guangdong in the <a href="2019%20Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong%20Kong%20Cup">2019 Guangdong–Hong Kong Cup</a>. His team won 5–2 in aggregate eventually and successfully defended the champion.
Yuen Long.
In July 2018, he was appointed as the head coach of <a href="Yuen%20Long%20FC">Yuen Long</a>. He led the club to finish 7th in the league, and his team was deemed as the overachiever of the league in the 2018–19 season. He left the club after the end of the season.
Tai Po.
In July 2019, Kwok was appointed as the co-head coach of <a href="Tai%20Po%20FC">Tai Po</a>, along with <a href="Fung%20Hoi%20Man">Fung Hoi Man</a>. However, he resigned only three months later, in November 2019.
Second tenure at Yuen Long.
On 1 February 2020, Kwok returned to <a href="Yuen%20Long%20FC">Yuen Long</a>, signing a contract until 31 May.
Second tenure at Pegasus.
On 10 May 2020, Pegasus reached an agreement to hire Kwok as their next head coach. He signed a two year contract with the club.
